tn.text: "Yahweh spoke his word." See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:01:01|1:1]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
Ezekiel (me)

tn.ref: prophesying out of their own imaginations
tn.text: prophesying from their own thoughts
This phrase is used to refer to the prophets doing what they want. The word "spirit" refers to their thoughts and the word "follow" refers to what they do. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
wild animals like dogs or a small wolves.
Like jackals that steal food from other animals in the desert, the prophets steal from the people of Israel when they lie about having messages from God. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:03:01|3:1]].
"defend"

tn.ref: Have you not had false visions ... when I myself have not spoken?
tn.text: Yahweh uses a question to rebuke the false prophets. AT: "You have had false visions ... because I myself have not spoken." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: had false visions and made false predictions
tn.text: Since the false prophets have not really received a message from Yahweh, what they predict about the future is not true.
This is a phrase used to refer to anything the prophet may have said. Your language may have another way to say this. "Yahweh told me this" (UDB)
See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:05:11|5:11]].
Yahweh speaks to the people of Israel and repeats phrases in different ways to express how true they are. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])

tn.ref: had false visions and have told lies
tn.text: AT: "have lied about having messages from God"
See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:05:11|5:11]].

tn.ref: My hand will be against the prophets
tn.text: The term "hand" is often used in reference to Yahweh's power.

tn.ref: have lying visions and who make false predictions
tn.text: AT: "who have messages from God but are lying"

tn.ref: in the assembly of my people, or enrolled in the record of the house of Israel
tn.text: AT: "listed as one of my people" This is two ways to describe the same thing. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])
See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:03:01|3:1]].

tn.ref: will know that I am the Lord Yahweh
tn.text: See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:06:06|6:7]].
The word "this" refers to the Lord's promise to force the false prophets out of Israel.
The word "they" refers to the false prophets in the land of Israel.

tn.ref: they are building a wall that they will paint with whitewash
tn.text: Here "a wall" stands for peace and security that the false prophets told the people that Yahweh was promising to give them. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
"whitewash" is a white liquid mixture used for making surfaces (such as walls or fences) whiter.
These are all part of a very bad storm. God uses a storm to refer to the armies that will attack Jerusalem. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
balls of ice that sometimes falls from the sky during a rainstorm.

tn.ref: Have others not said to you ... it?
tn.text: Ezekiel asks this as a question to press for an answer. AT: "Others have certainly said to you ... it!"
These are all part of a very bad storm. God uses a storm to refer to the armies that will attack Jerusalem. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: I will bring a windstorm in my rage
tn.text: "when I act on my anger I will bring a windstorm"

tn.ref: there will be floods of rain in my wrath
tn.text: "when I act on my anger I will bring large amounts of rain"

tn.ref: Hailstones in my rage will completely destroy it
tn.text: "When I act on my anger I will bring hailstones to destroy the walls the people are building"
"uncover"
"brought to your end" or "totally destroyed"
Possible meanings are 1) "understand who I, Yahweh, am" or 2) "understand that I am Yahweh, the one true God" or 3) "know that I, Yahweh, have the power to do what I say that I will do" (UDB)
refers to Yahweh

tn.ref: I will annihilate in my fury
tn.text: "when I act on my anger I will bring to an end"
"painted the wall white" (See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:13:10|13:10]])

tn.ref: The wall exists no more, nor do the people
tn.text: "The wall is no longer there, nor are the people"
The word "her" refers to Jerusalem.

tn.ref: this is the Lord Yahweh's declaration
tn.text: See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:05:11|5:11]].
See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:02:01|2:3]].
See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:04:01|4:3]].
women of Israel

tn.ref: prophesy out of their own minds
tn.text: This means they are creating prophecies from their own imaginations. AT: "imagining their own prophecies" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:04:06|4:7]].
objects believed to have magical powers.

tn.ref: make veils for their heads of every size, used to hunt down people
tn.text: The decorations worn by prophetesses were like a "trap" because they were using beauty, mystery and lies to trick the people so they would believe them and sin against God. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Yahweh continues to speak against the false prophetesses in Israel.

tn.ref: handfuls of barley and crumbs of bread
tn.text: Barley is a grain used to make bread and the word "crumb" is a small amount of bread. Both phrases are small amounts of food and are used to emphasize how small the payment was to the prophetesses. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])
See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:05:05|5:5]].
objects that are believed to have magic powers
"to trap." A snare is a small looped rope that catches something by the foot.

tn.ref: ensnare the people's lives as if they were birds ... people whom you have trapped like birds
tn.text: Yahweh is comparing the prophetesses' decorations to traps for a bird. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])

The word "arms" refers to the control by the prophetesses. The lies they use to control the people of Israel are like arms that hold them back from escaping. AT: "take them away from your control" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

tn.ref: they will no longer be trapped in your hands
tn.text: To say they will not be trapped is the same as saying they will be free. The phrase "trapped in your hand" refers to the people of Israel being in the control of the false prophetesses. AT: "they will be free from you control" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_litotes]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
Possible meanings are 1) "understand who I, Yahweh, am" or 2) "understand that I am Yahweh, the one true God" or 3) "know that I, Yahweh, have the power to do what I say that I will do" (UDB)

tn.ref: discourage the heart of the righteous person
tn.text: The righteous person's heart is used to refer to their emotions. AT: "discourage the righteous person" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
To stop doing something is referred to as turning in a different direction. AT: "stop what he is doing" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: have false visions or continue to make predictions
tn.text: Both of these phrases refer to talking about what will happen in the future. AT: "continue to make false predictions" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])
The word "hand" is used to refer to the control of the prophetess. AT: "out of your control" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
Possible meanings are 1) "understand who I, Yahweh, am" or 2) "understand that I am Yahweh, the one true God" or 3) "know that I, Yahweh, have the power to do what I say that I will do" (UDB)
